intro: Cissus thwaitesii, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Cissus thwaitesii is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
